thread.title: Bankwest scraps negative gearing tax benefits in loan assessments
thread.title_full: Bankwest scraps negative gearing tax benefits in loan assessments

author: Clancy Yeates
title: Bankwest scraps negative gearing tax benefits in loan assessments
text:
French presidential hopeful Macron ... French presidential hopeful Macron dismisses affair 
France's presidential election campaign lurched deeper into uncertainty on Tuesday after centrist Emmanuel Macron was forced to deny an extramarital affair while financial scandal continued to dog conservative rival Francois Fillon. More videos 'Same problems as London': Morrison doubles down on negative gearing 
High property prices in the UK show that Australia's housing affordability crisis is not related to negative gearing, Treasurer Scott Morrison told business leaders in Marylebone, in the UK. 
After CBA and Bankwest last week froze new refinancing loans for property investor customers from other banks, the move will limit how much credit the bank can extend to customers with negatively geared properties. 
It is a further attempt to slow down growth in investor loans to comply with the regulator's 10 per cent a year speed limit . Related Content CBA first-half profits tipped to hit $4.84 billion 
Major banks have on occasion used their smaller brands to make policy changes that are then implemented by their main divisions, and The Australian Financial Review reported that CBA, the country's biggest bank, was also expected to implement the crackdown. 
CBA, which is tipped to deliver a $4.84 billion half-year profit at its results on Wednesda y, did not comment. Advertisement 
A Bankwest spokesman said the change was in line with guidance from regulators, and it would being the lender into line with "industry best practice". 
Changes such as these have become more common in the past two years, with banks often tweaking their lending policies and rules on minimum deposits in order to comply with rules introduced to cool investor lending. SHARE
